Updated November     pm



The Washington womens soccer team opens up its spring season this evening against Seattle Pacific at home PERIOD

The Huskies who finished  with a  record are looking to better that mark in the fall this time without forward Veronica Perez who moved on to play in the professional ranks PERIOD

 head coach Lesle Gallimore said PERIOD 

Gallimore said she sees this fall as a time for her more experienced players to step up PERIOD

 Gallimore said PERIOD

Gallimore is entering her seventeenth season at Washington which is the longest tenure of any coach in the conference PERIOD

 Gallimore said PERIOD

There are numerous players who have caught Gallimores eye and five upperclassmen in particular junior forward McKenna Waitley sophomore forward Alex Webber sophomore midfielder Kate Deines junior defender Kendyl Pele and junior midfielder Jane Mitchell PERIOD

 Gallimore said of the five players PERIOD

The team is coming off a secondround loss in the NCAA tournament to 2ndranked Portland PERIOD However like any team the Huskies will try to have a short memory and look to push on with a mix of veterans and youth PERIOD

 Gallimore said PERIOD

Although her five freshmen did not necessarily get consistent playing time in the fall the spring will be an opportunity to get a jump on this coming season PERIOD

 Gallimore said PERIOD 

As far as a breakout season goes Gallimore had no hesitation Mitchell will be the player PERIOD

 Gallimore said PERIOD 

That doesnt take away from the excitement her coaching staff shares PERIOD

 Gallimore said PERIOD

Washington with a somewhat limited roster for the spring is looking to come together as a group and take advantage of these games by working on attacking using different formations and pace PERIOD

After tonights match against Seattle Pacific the Huskies will take on Gonzaga on Sunday afternoon at home PERIOD

Reach reporter Mark Morgan at sportsdailyuw.com PERIOD
